dialogueTree.characterInternalMonologue: Here we go again, another salesperson. They never seem to understand my time is precious. I have to stay focused and not get distracted by their chatter.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I wonder what angle they're going to take this time. Will they be logical, or just another empty pitch?

options.text: This pen has been engineered for precision and endurance, perfect for your notes.
options.characterResponse: Interesting, I appreciate the focus on precision. Tell me more about its endurance.

options.text: You should just buy this pen because everyone else is!
options.characterResponse: That's not a compelling reason. I make decisions based on logic, not trends.

options.text: Honestly, you just need to lighten up and enjoy life more.
options.characterResponse: That's not helpful at all. I prefer to take things seriously, thank you.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They seem to respond better when I engage with logic. Let's see if they can keep it up.

options.text: This pen's ergonomic design can help reduce strain during long writing sessions.
options.characterResponse: That's a good point. Ergonomics are important, especially for someone like me.

options.text: I just think you need a new pen for a fresh start.
options.characterResponse: A fresh start is nice, but I need something more tangible to justify the purchase.

options.text: You seem like someone who doesn't care about the small things.
options.characterResponse: You're mistaken. The small things matter a lot to me. You've lost me.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They're on a roll, but I need to see how they handle objections. Let's challenge them.

options.text: This pen is made from sustainable materials, which aligns with being responsible.
options.characterResponse: I value sustainability. It's refreshing to see that consideration.

options.text: You should just trust me, it’s a great pen.
options.characterResponse: Trust is built on evidence, not just words. I need more than that.

options.text: You probably won't understand why this pen is better than others.
options.characterResponse: That's a condescending thing to say. I do understand, and you've lost my interest.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They're still trying, but can they really appeal to my analytical side? Let's see.

options.text: The statistics show that users of this pen report higher satisfaction rates.
options.characterResponse: Now that's what I'm talking about! I appreciate data-driven insights.

options.text: Just pick it up and see how it feels.
options.characterResponse: That's way too vague. I need specifics, not just sensations.

options.text: Everyone says it's good, so you should buy it.
options.characterResponse: Popularity does not equal quality. That’s not a convincing argument.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: If they can seal the deal with one last point, I might just go for it. Let's see what they’ve got.

options.text: Investing in quality tools like this pen can elevate your work and enhance productivity.
options.characterResponse: That’s a solid argument. Elevating my work is always a priority. I'll take it.

options.text: You need to think about how much more fun your writing will be.
options.characterResponse: Fun is not my primary concern. I need practical benefits.

options.text: Honestly, it's just a pen. Don't make this so complicated.
options.characterResponse: That’s dismissive. I like to think things through, and you've made it worse.

dialogueTree.successEnding: Ruby nods thoughtfully and accepts the pen, appreciating the logical approach taken during the conversation.
dialogueTree.failureEnding: Ruby shakes her head, frustrated, and rolls away, leaving you to rethink your approach.
